alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 4:49PM MDT until August 25 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Pikes Peak, Teller County and the Rampart Range, Fremont County, the northern Sangre De Cristo and Wet Mountains, the Wet Mountain Valley and El Paso, Pueblo, Crowley and Otero counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms capable of producing intense rainfall rates will remain possible over the mountains and adjacent locations across the plains this evening. Burn scars and urban areas will be most prone to flash flooding. However, flooding will also be possible where storms redevelop over or near steep terrain, or for locations that receive repeated rounds of heavy rainfall. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft
